title: Engineering Talent Pool
content:
We're Celonis, the global leader in execution management and process mining technology, and one of the 50 most valuable private companies in the world. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us.








 
The Opportunity:At Celonis, our Software Engineers are tackling complex challenges and pioneering advances in analytics, data mining, knowledge management, machine learning, automation, user experience, AI, and more. And we're doing it at a scale that's never been seen before.Whether you’re focused on frontend, backend, or somewhere in between - we have challenges that need solving across our entire technology stack, from multi-cloud to database systems to real-time data streaming to our end-user experience.The Roles:Today, we’re looking for Engineers to support several Celonis functions:

Frontend: Frontend Engineers create and improve highly interactive and scalable UI components and data visualizations using Typescript, Angular, D3.js, and many other technologies. They are constantly optimizing app performance and rendering for large amounts of data, and play an active role in product discussions, influencing the roadmap and user experience.
Fullstack: Full Stack Engineers are responsible for building new features, designing and implementing useful APIs and increasing the reliability of our services continuously. As their name suggests, they are covering the complete stack: infrastructure topics with Kubernetes and Argo CD, microservice and API design with Java 11 and Spring Boot, and frontend topics with Typescript and Angular.
Backend: Backend Engineers build new features, design and implement APIs and increase the reliability of our services continuously. The team also takes ownership of features from design to operation and strives to improve and automate our development processes.
SRE/Platform: Site Reliability Engineers are part of the team that owns the health of our product and ensures its end-to-end availability and performance according to defined SLOs. They apply strong troubleshooting skills and strategic disaster recovery thinking with both software engineering and SRE principles to design, write and deliver software, improve availability, scalability and efficiency of our product. 
QA/SDET: QA Engineers work to improve processes across squads and shift quality left so that we surface quality issues early and often. The team focuses on integrating toolsets and examining processes to make sure we don't have any more manual effort than necessary, that we have sufficient but minimal process, and that we're also fully auditable and our work is repeatable.

The skills we typically look for:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a similar field
Excellent English verbal and written communication skills
Proven, hands-on experience in software development 
Technologically agnostic with OOP languages including C++, Java, etc.  
Familiarity with data structures and algorithms, profiling and optimization
Ability to write clear, understandable and testable code with continuous focus on maintainability
Experience building good REST APIs
At least a high-level understanding of domain, product and architecture
Ability to solve complex problems with limited supervision
Experience leading engineering projects throughout the SDLC
What Celonis can offer you:

The unique opportunity to work within a new category of technology, Execution Management
Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here
Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counselling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

About Us
Since 2011, Celonis has helped thousands of the world’s largest and most esteemed companies yield immediate cash impact, radically improve customer experience, and reduce carbon emissions. Its Process Intelligence platform uses industry-leading process mining technology and AI to present companies with a living digital twin of their end-to-end processes. For the first time, everyone in an organization has a common language for how the business runs, visibility into where value is hiding, and the ability to capture it. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York City, USA with more than 20 offices worldwide.
Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws.  As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.  Different makes us better.
